snippet: Four days after Hurricane Sandy, the major carriers — AT&T, Verizon Wireless, T-Mobile USA and Sprint — were still rebuilding their networks in the hardest-hit areas.
abstract: Wireless customers are angry that four days after Hurricane Sandy, major carriers AT&T, Verizon Wireless, T-Mobile USA and Sprint are still rebuilding their networks in the hardest-hit areas; Federal Communications Commission says one-quarter of the cell towers in the storm zone were knocked out; carriers say they are trying their best to deal with unusual disaster.
lead_paragraph: Four days after Hurricane Sandy, the major carriers — AT&T, Verizon Wireless, T-Mobile USA and Sprint — were still rebuilding their networks in the hardest-hit areas.

headline.main: Cellphone Users Steaming at Hit-or-Miss Service
headline.print_headline: Cellphone Users Steaming at Hit-or-Miss Service
